hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a period of low volatility (Bollinger Band Width < 0.05) in a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout above the 20-day upper Bollinger Band on increasing volume (>1.5x 20-day average) signals the start of a short-term directional trend that persists for 3-5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low volatility in neutral markets represents pent-up energy. A clean breakout on high volume suggests genuine institutional or large trader participation, not just retail FOMO. The 3-5 day persistence aligns with typical momentum unwinding cycles.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day Bollinger Band Width < 0.05 for 5 consecutive days
BTC price closes > 20-day upper Bollinger Band
Volume on breakout day > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% price move from entry OR 5 days in trade
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Close back inside Bollinger Bands (below upper band)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >60% of such breakouts immediately reverse (close back inside bands within 2 days) and show negative average returns over the 5-day window, the hypothesis fails.
